briefTitle: MR-guided RAdiotherapy to Breast With Dose Escalation to regionaL Lymph NodEs
officialTitle: MR-guided RAdiotherapy to Breast With Dose Escalation to regionaL Lymph NodEs
primaryOutcomeMeasure: The number of patients in whom a higher dose can be delivered to the level IV (SCF) nodes without breaching brachial plexus constraints on the radiotherapy plans created using MR images compared with CT images
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Age ≥18 years
* Female or male
* Invasive carcinoma of the breast (left or right-sided)
* cT1-T4,N3,M0-1 disease
* Due to proceed to primary treatment (chemo, surgery, radiotherapy and/or endocrine therapy)
* Histopathological involvement of axillary lymph nodes confirmed on FNA or Bx
* Likely to undergo locoregional radiotherapy as part of their breast cancer management

Exclusion Criteria:

* Implanted pacemakers and/or pacing wires
* Cochlear implants
* Programmable hydrocephalus shunts
* Implanted neurostimulation systems
* Implanted drug infusion pumps
* Ferromagnetic implants
* Claustrophobia
